patient_info: Proteinuria,Hypertension,Fever,Hypercholesterolemia,Elevated circulating creatinine concentration,Severe sensorineural hearing impairment,Abnormal urinary color,Macroscopic hematuria,Cylindruria
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Alport syndrome - This is a rare genetic disorder that mainly affects the kidneys, ears, and eyes. It is the most likely diagnosis given the proteinuria, hypertension, elevated circulating creatinine concentration, and abnormal urinary color. The severe sensorineural hearing impairment, macroscopic hematuria, and cylindruria are also consistent with the phenotype of Alport syndrome, and the elevated cholesterol and uric acid levels are also common features.
2. Fulminant interglomerulonephritis (FNIGN) - This is a severe form of kidney disease characterized by inflammation of the glomeruli, the tiny structures in the kidney that filter blood. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, and hematuria, which match the patient's symptoms. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria may also be associated with FNIGN, although these features are not as common.
3. Goodpasture disease - This is a rare disorder that affects the kidneys and lungs, characterized by inflammation of the basement membrane of blood vessels. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, and hematuria, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria are not common features of Goodpasture disease, although they may occur in some cases.
4. Membranous nephropathy - This is a chronic kidney disease characterized by the thickening of the basement membrane of the glomeruli. It can cause proteinuria, elevated circulating creatinine concentration, and hematuria, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria may also be associated with membranous nephropathy, although these features are not as common.
5. Anti-phospholipid syndrome (APS) - This is a rare autoimmune disorder characterized by the production of autoantibodies against phospholipids and other structures in the blood vessels. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, and hematuria, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria may also be features of APS, although these are not as common.
6. Lupus nephritis - This is a chronic kidney disease that can occur in systemic lupus erythematosus, a connective tissue disorder characterized by the production of autoantibodies. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, and hematuria, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria may also be associated with lupus nephritis, although these features are not as common.
7. Hypocomplementemic uremic syndrome (HCUS) - This is a rare genetic disorder characterized by the deficiency of proteins involved in complement activation and regulation, leading to kidney damage and other organ dysfunction. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, and hematuria, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria are rare features of HCUS, but have been reported in some cases.
8. Goodpasture's disease with C3 nephritis - This is a rare combination of Goodpasture's disease and complement atypic hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS), characterized by the involvement of the kidneys and other organs. It can cause proteinuria, hypertension, thrombotic microangiopathy, and renal ischemia, which are seen in the patient. The sensorineural hearing loss and cylindruria are associated with Goodpasture's disease with C3 nephritis, although these features are not as common.
